overview: Social and emotional development and wellbeing is directly connected to successful academic outcomes, strong relationships and school belonging. Teacher Candidates will develop skills to foster the collective and individual connections to people, place, culture and community that are central to wellbeing. This work is informed by multiple perspectives of and approaches to social and emotional wellbeing for children, families, and educators.

This subject references the Australian/Victorian Early Years Learning and Development Frameworks and Curricula. Policies and frameworks will help guide pedagogical and assessment practice decisions working within and across early years services and settings and in the early years of school. Teacher Candidates will deepen their understanding of the importance of wellbeing, examine and practice building social and emotional skills, and identify pathways for strengthening children’s capabilities of their own wellbeing and identity.

assessments.description: Presentation: Create and present a lesson on social and emotional well-being (1500 words equivalent). 15 minutes
Reflection: Written reflection on understandings of learning environments. 1000 words
Professional Plan: Design a partnership plan to support social and emotional well-being. 2500 words (equivalent)
Peer Feedback. Hurdle requirement:. Teacher Candidates must provide written peer feedback on least one or more classmates' presenations.

Attendance. Hurdle requirement:. A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).

Semester 1.Contact hours: 24 hours (16 hours of on-campus classes and 8 hours of asynchronous online activities)

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
